HEA.tools package¶

Package contents¶

Package with tool functions used within the library HEA.

Submodules¶

HEA.tools.assertion module¶

Module with functions to assert a statement:

  • assert that a python object is a list or tuple

  • some assertion function (used internally)

HEA.tools.assertion.is_list_tuple(L)[source]¶

Check that L is a list or a tuple

Lpython object

potential list or tuple

bool:

True if L is a list or a tuple, else False

HEA.tools.da module¶

Data handling: function to manipulate lists and dictionnary

  • Transform an element into a list

  • Check if a list is included in another

  • Add a key-value couple to a dictionnary if the key is not in the dictionnary

  • …

HEA.tools.da.add_in_dic(key, dic, default=None)[source]¶

if a key is not in the dictionnary dic, add it with value specified by default. In place.

keyimmutable python object

new key of the dictionnary

dicdict

dictionary that might contain the key

defaultpython object

default value of the key is not in the dic

HEA.tools.da.el_to_list(el, len_list)[source]¶

Turn a single non-list element el into a list of size len_list

elpython object

element

len_listint

length of the list to create

transformed_elpython object

If el is a list, el. Else, list of size len_list: [el, el, ...]

A function taking two variables might have arguments that need to be a 2-list, whose elements correspond to the two variables. This function allows for the user to specify only a common element that will be converted into a 2-list.

HEA.tools.da.flatten_2Dlist(L2)[source]¶

Flatten a n-dimensional list into a (n-1)-dimensional list (if it is indeed a list of dimension greater than or equal to 2)

L2 : python object

python object or 2D list

Flatten (n-1)-dimensional list

HEA.tools.da.get_element_list(L, index)[source]¶

Return an element of a list/tuple. If L is not a list, returns it directly.

Lpython object

potential list

indexint

index of the list to get

python object

If list_candidate is a list its element if index index. Else, returns list_candidate

HEA.tools.da.list_included(L1, L2)[source]¶

Check whether the list L1 included in the list L2

L1: list

potential sub-list

L2: list

potential larger list

L1_included_L2: bool

True if L1 included in L2, else False

HEA.tools.da.show_dictionnary(dic, name_dic=None)[source]¶

Print the dictionnary elements with line break

dic: dict

dictionnary to show

name_dic: str or None

name of the dictionnary

HEA.tools.dir module¶

Module to create directories

HEA.tools.dir.create_directory(directory, name_folder=None)[source]¶

Creates a folder in {directory}/{name_folder}

name of the directory where to create the folder

name_folderstr

name of the folder to create

path: str

{directory}/{name_folder}

HEA.tools.dir.try_makedirs(path)[source]¶

Create all the necessary directories of a path

pathstr

path

HEA.tools.serial module¶

Serialisation into JSON and pickle files

HEA.tools.serial.dump_json(data, file_name=None, folder_name=None, *, library='json', byte_write=False, **params)¶

Save the data in a file in {loc['out']}/{type_data}/

datapython object

element to be saved (can be a list) if type_data is ‘json’, must be a dictionnary

file_namestr

name of the pickle file

folder_namestr

name of folder where the json file is (if None, there is no folder)

library‘json’ or ‘pickle’

library used to save the file

byte_write: bool

Write in byte mode

paramsdict

parameters passed to the dump function of the corresponding serial library.

HEA.tools.serial.dump_pickle(data, file_name=None, folder_name=None, *, library='pickle', byte_write=True, **params)¶

Dump a pickle file in {loc['pickle']}/ (in byte mode)

datapython object

element to be saved (can be a list)

file_namestr

name of the pickle file

folder_namestr

name of folder where the pickle file is saved (if None, there is no folder)

HEA.tools.serial.get_latex_column_table(L)[source]¶

Return a sub latex column table from a list

Llist

List whose each element is a cellule of the sub latex column table

latex_tablestr

latex column table

HEA.tools.serial.retrieve_json(file_name, folder_name=None, *, library='json', byte_read=False)¶

Retrieve the content of a json file

file_namestr

name of the file

folder_namestr

name of folder where the json file is (if None, there is no folder)

dict

dict stored in the json file in {loc['json']}/{folder_name}/{name_data}.json

HEA.tools.serial.retrieve_pickle(file_name, folder_name=None, *, library='pickle', byte_read=True)¶

Retrieve the content of a pickle file

file_namestr

name of the file

folder_namestr

name of folder where the pickle file is (if None, there is no folder)

Python object or dic

python object stored in a pickle file in {loc['pickle']}/{folder_name}/{name_data}.pickle

HEA.tools.string module¶

Module to manipulate strings.

HEA.tools.string.add_text(text1, text2, sep=' ', default=None)[source]¶

concatenate 2 texts with sep between them, unless one of them is None

text1str

text at the beginning

text2str

text at the end

sepstr

separator between text1 and text2

defaultstr or None

default value to return if both text1 and text2 are None

str

'{text1}_{text2}' if they are both not None. Else, return text1, or text2, or default is they are both None

HEA.tools.string.list_into_string(L, sep='_')[source]¶

Transform a list into a string of elements seperated by sep

Llist

list

sepstr

separator used to separate each element of the list

str

string with all the elements separated by the argument sep

HEA.tools.string.string_between_brackets(text, bracket=None)[source]¶

Return the correct text for the label of plots

textstr

Text that might be put into brackets

bracket‘(‘, ‘[‘ or None

string of bracket around text

  • '(' : parenthetis

  • '[' : bracket

  • None : no brackets

str

string with

  • a space before it

  • between the brackets specified by bracket
